## Librerias

```{r}
library("tidyverse")
library("naniar")
library("ggthemes")
library("readxl")
library("lubridate")
library("dplyr")
```

## Punto 1

```{r}
IHSM <- read_delim("Datos/IHSM.csv", delim = ";")
regresion_1 <- read_delim("Datos/Regresion_1.csv", delim = ";")
regresion_2 <- read_delim("Datos/Regresion_2.csv", delim = ";")
```

## Punto 3

```{r}
IHSM <- left_join(IHSM, regresion_1, by = c("paises_P","ano"))
IHSM <- left_join(IHSM, regresion_2, by = c("paises_P","ano"))
```

## Punto 4

```{r}
IHSM <- IHSM %>% 
  mutate(across(.cols = c("paises_P","codigo"),~as.factor(.x)))
```

## Punto 5

```{r}
##  Creamos la variable IHSM 

  # Consideramos la fiabilidad de las variables, con un indicador de suma 

  IHSM <- IHSM %>% 
  mutate(suma = ANS+DP+ESQ+BI+DA+AH+DR+SU)

  # Alfa de Cronbach

  for (i in 4:11) {
  dato <- var(IHSM[i],na.rm = TRUE)
  print(dato)
  }
    
  varianza_variables <- 1.363118+0.4301509+0.00195831+0.02944265+0.8292454+0.8292454

```
